thread.title: The 10-Point.

author: Gerard Baker
title: The 10-Point.
text:
Good morning,
Trading Places
As their trade war of words continues, Washington and Beijing are quietly starting to negotiate improved U.S. access to Chinese markets. The talks—which cover wide areas including financial services and manufacturing—are being led by economic czar Liu He on the Chinese side and Treasury Secretary Steven Mnuchin and trade representative Robert Lighthizer for the U.S. The Trump administration, seeking to narrow the U.S.’s $375 billion merchandise trade deficit, set out specific requests, including...
